title: Plane stops takeoff at Logan Airport after shooting flames, smoke
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News A plane stopped its takeoff at Boston Logan Airport Tuesday evening after flames and smoke spurted from the back of the aircraft, a video captured by Boston25 News shows.

title: MIT investigating messages of hate, violence found on campus over the past week
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News President Sally Kornbluth said the incidents, which did not appear connected, include two hand-drawn swastikas, a sign wishing violence on a conservative non-profit, and an email list of “messages celebrating violence.
" MIT police are investigating numerous instances of hateful speech and images around campus, President Sally Kornbluth said in a letter to the MIT community Friday.

Kornbluth said the incidents — two hand-drawn swastikas, a sign wishing violence on a conservative non-profit, and cases of graffiti and an email list of “messages celebrating violence” — do not seem to be connected.

title: Brockton man arrested in connection with fatal Fitchburg stabbing
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Crime Fitchburg police arrived at Chester Street in response to a reported incident with a knife and found a man who had been stabbed, the DA said.
A man was found fatally stabbed in Fitchburg Tuesday morning, and a man was later arrested in connection with his killing, prosecutors announced.

title: Somerville has a new cat mayor: Meet Minerva
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News Minerva, a black cat whose slogan was simply — and sinisterly — “CRIME,” was selected as mayor after an election process that captivated Somerville.
Signs along the bike path in the race for "bike path mayor.

" Suzanne Kreiter/The Boston Globe By Sana Muneer September 16, 2025 | 7:13 PM 1 minute to read A feisty feline was elected Somerville’s new “bike path mayor” Tuesday, reigning over more than a dozen cats and even two dogs.
